abstract: Despite the federal government’s repeated pledges to crack down on big businesses that underpay their taxes, the Internal Revenue Service has decreased in recent years the time it spends auditing the returns of the nation’s largest corporations, The New York Times reported, citing a new study.
snippet: Despite the federal government’s repeated pledges to crack down on big businesses that underpay their taxes, the Internal Revenue Service has decreased in recent years the time it spends auditing the returns of the nation’s largest corporations, T...
lead_paragraph: Despite the federal government’s repeated pledges to crack down on big businesses that underpay their taxes, the Internal Revenue Service has in recent years decreased the time it spends auditing the returns of the nation’s largest corporations, The New York Times’s David Kocieniewski reported, citing a new study.

headline.main: Tax Audits of Big Business Are Declining, Study Says
